channel.title: UTorrent PortForwarding Detailed For TOTAL NOOOOBS
channel.description:
First off, go to your default - gateway. If you don't know how to get there, open up your start menu.
[img]http://screensnapr.com/e/EbmhaK.png[/img]
In the search box, type and enter CMD.
[img]http://screensnapr.com/e/TVxVZU.png[/img]
[img]http://screensnapr.com/e/Zpi0kK.png[/img]
The Command Prompt window will pop-up.
[img]http://screensnapr.com/e/KkhnYJ.png[/img]
Type ipconfig, scroll up, and you'll see a window like this. I've whitened my ip's. ;)
[img]http://screensnapr.com/e/8VZ5nY.png[/img]
Goto your default gateway, which in my case is something like this : 192.***.*.*** Whilst your default gateway is loading, you may be asked for your username / pass. It's usually Administrator as the username, and Admin as the password, but you can check your routers default user/pass at [url=http://www.routerpasswords.com]http://www.routerpasswords.com[/url]
After reaching your default gateway, you'll see a window that might not look exactly like this, as you may have another router.
[img]http://screensnapr.com/e/ypRgcq.png[/img]
Surf your default gateway until you find your "ToolBox".
[img]http://screensnapr.com/e/99NOgX.png[/img] [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/UujKIa.png[/img]
Goto your toolbox. You may see something like this,
[img]http://screensnapr.com/e/NCF0kp.png[/img] Goto your Games & Application Sharing
[img]http://screensnapr.com/e/htJpPg.png[/img]
[b]Remember to check that your UpnP is enabled. ONLY IF YOU HAVE ATLEAST IN TOTAL 2 OTHER DEVICES CONNECTED TO YOUR INTERNET,THAT ARE NOT COMPUTERS. I.E Ps3, Xbox, Wii[/b]
[img]http://screensnapr.com/e/gonZTy.png[/img] Otherwise disable your UpnP.
Your window might look somewhat like this,
[img]http://screensnapr.com/e/4cQwpS.png[/img] I Suggest disabling your extended settings, so you won't encounter problems later on.
[img]http://screensnapr.com/e/Kkl1lq.png[/img]
If you have no Games & Applicatications assigned, thats good. If you do, I suggest removing the ones that use the ports 43594 or 5555 ( The port your wanting to forward. )
Now we go to Utorrent. Download the latest version of Utorrent,
[img]http://screensnapr.com/e/LMZ4Eo.png[/img] I'll be using version 3.1
Open up your Utorrent, after installing it.
[img]http://screensnapr.com/e/nfQJ3m.png[/img]
[img]http://screensnapr.com/e/flO3Qx.png[/img]
Go to your options,
[img]http://screensnapr.com/e/cqGMB2.png[/img] You'll see a drop-down menu like this,
[img]http://screensnapr.com/e/YVqRwY.png[/img]
Go to your preferences,
You'll see a window like this, [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/2zWTWk.png[/img] Copy the exact settings as mine, but with the port replaced with the port you wish to forward.
[img]http://screensnapr.com/e/gKEGnF.png[/img]
Click on apply, then ok,
[img]http://screensnapr.com/e/NfMyob.png[/img] [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/AxTG55.png[/img] Now go to options, but this time, click on setup guide, [b]OR[/b], press [code]Control + G[/code] [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/wq2sHR.png[/img]
You'll see a window like this, [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/pbY8UP.png[/img] Now, un-tick the Bandwith checkbox. [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/3jcHwr.png[/img]
Make sure your Network checkbox is ticked. [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/2QREXE.png[/img] Change the port in the box, to the port that you wanted to forward, and make sure the Automatic Port Mapping checkbox is ticked. [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/ZeN5bl.png[/img]
Then click on Run tests, [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/TNpK5f.png[/img] [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/L4tOX1.png[/img] You should hopefully see a green tick, after a bit of checking, [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/gNEPSg.png[/img] [img]http://screensnapr.com/e/aZMUQM.png[/img]
[img]http://screensnapr.com/e/SCeTgS.png[/img] If you see a red cross or a orange cross, repeat the steps from when u open Utorrent up. Remember that you MUST CLICK ON SAVE & CLOSE. Thanks for reading. I know many Utorrent forwarding guides have been posted here, but I posted one with a bit more detail that targets beginners, with added information on removing the pre-assigned port forwarding settings on your default gateway.
Now, if your wondering why I asked you to remove any pre-assigned port forwarding optionas related to any ports you wish to open in your default gateway, it was because Utorrent wouldn't open the port correctly.

item.title: UTorrent PortForwarding Detailed For TOTAL NOOOOBS
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

Well there is already tuts for this and like Tutorial says = true
but I have to say, this is actually a very nice tutorial
gj on putting so much effort in it,
if noobs don’t get this they shouldn’t be using a computer

Read full topic

item.title: UTorrent PortForwarding Detailed For TOTAL NOOOOBS
item.dc:creator: @Decronix Decronix
item.description:
@Decronix wrote:

First off,
go to your default - gateway.
If you don’t know how to get there, open up your start menu.

In the search box, type and enter CMD.

The Command Prompt window will pop-up.

Type ipconfig, scroll up, and you’ll see a window like this.
I’ve whitened my ip’s.

Goto your default gateway, which in my case is something like this : 192.**..***
Whilst your default gateway is loading, you may be asked for your username / pass.
It’s usually Administrator as the username, and Admin as the password,
but you can check your routers default user/pass at
http://www.routerpasswords.com

After reaching your default gateway, you’ll see a window that might not look exactly like this, as you may have another router.

Surf your default gateway until you find your “ToolBox”.


Goto your toolbox.
You may see something like this,


Goto your Games & Application Sharing

Remember to check that your UpnP is enabled. ONLY IF YOU HAVE ATLEAST IN TOTAL 2 OTHER DEVICES CONNECTED TO YOUR INTERNET,THAT ARE NOT COMPUTERS. I.E Ps3, Xbox, Wii


Otherwise disable your UpnP.

Your window might look somewhat like this,


I Suggest disabling your extended settings, so you won’t
encounter problems later on.

If you have no Games & Applicatications assigned, thats good. If you do, I suggest removing the ones that use the ports 43594 or 5555 ( The port your wanting to forward. )

Now we go to Utorrent.
Download the latest version of Utorrent,


I’ll be using version 3.1

Open up your Utorrent, after installing it.

Go to your options,


You’ll see a drop-down menu like this,

Go to your preferences,

You’ll see a window like this,

Copy the exact settings as mine, but with the port replaced with the port you wish to forward.

Click on apply, then ok,



Now go to options, but this time, click on setup guide, OR, press Control + G

You’ll see a window like this,

Now, un-tick the Bandwith checkbox.

Make sure your Network checkbox is ticked.

Change the port in the box, to the port that you wanted to forward, and make sure the Automatic Port Mapping checkbox is ticked.

Then click on Run tests,


You should hopefully see a green tick, after a bit of checking,


If you see a red cross or a orange cross, repeat the steps from when u open Utorrent up.
Remember that you MUST CLICK ON SAVE & CLOSE.
Thanks for reading.
I know many Utorrent forwarding guides have been posted here, but I posted one with a bit more detail that targets beginners, with added information on removing the pre-assigned port forwarding settings on your default gateway.

Now, if your wondering why I asked you to remove any pre-assigned port forwarding optionas related to any ports you wish to open in your default gateway, it was because Utorrent wouldn’t open the port correctly.

Read full topic
